unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) infrastructure is accelerating, driven by both government initiatives and private sector investment. Reliance Jio announced on 10/26/2023 that it has connected over 5 million homes with JioFiber, offering high-speed internet and bundled services.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of Fiber-to-the-Home (F T T H) infrastructure is accelerating, driven by both government initiatives and private sector investment. Reliance Jio announced on twenty-sixth october two thousand and twenty three that it has connected over five million homes with JioFiber, offering high-speed internet and bundled services.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel is also aggressively expanding its Airtel Xstream Fiber network, targeting Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities like Lucknow and Patna. Industry analysts predict that FTTH penetration will reach 30% by 2025, fuelled by the increasing demand for bandwidth-intensive applications, including streaming video and online education.
normalised: Bharti Airtel is also aggressively expanding its Airtel Xstream Fiber network, targeting Tier two and Tier three cities like Lucknow and Patna. Industry analysts predict that F T T H penetration will reach thirty percent by two thousand and twenty five, fuelled by the increasing demand for bandwidth-intensive applications, including streaming video and online education.

unnormalised: BSNL, as part of its revival package, plans to connect rural areas through FTTH. The BharatNet project aims to connect all Gram Panchayats with high-speed internet by 31/12/2024. A recent tender floated on 05/07/2023 at 14:00 hrs involves laying approximately 2000 km of optical fiber cable in Rajasthan. This push will help bridge the digital divide between urban and rural India, improving access to information and opportunities for all citizens. The initiative is expected to generate employment and contribute to the nation's economic growth. Further updates are anticipated at the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) meeting scheduled for next week.
normalised: B S N L, as part of its revival package, plans to connect rural areas through F T T H. The BharatNet project aims to connect all Gram Panchayats with high-speed internet by thirty-first december two thousand and twenty four. A recent tender floated on fifth july two thousand and twenty three at fourteen hundred hours involves laying approximately two thousand kilometer of optical fiber cable in Rajasthan. This push will help bridge the digital divide between urban and rural India, improving access to information and opportunities for all citizens. The initiative is expected to generate employment and contribute to the nation's economic growth. Further updates are anticipated at the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) meeting scheduled for next week.
